verbose_text: The low critical solution temperature (LCST) of nanogels, which was used to characterize the temperature sensitive hydrophilic-hydrophobic transition behavior, increased from 25 o C to 31 o C as the amount of the added hydrophilic iohexol (an X-ray contrast in clinical use) increased from 50 mg I/mL to 350 mg I/mL.
evidence: amount of the added hydrophilic iohexol
